alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 8:10AM EDT until July 14 at 9:15AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Holmes County in the panhandle of Florida... Jackson County in the panhandle of Florida... * Until 815 AM CDT. * At 710 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 6 and 9 inches of rain have fallen in the last 4 Hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Graceville, Marianna, Cottondale, Campbellton, Jacob City, Jacobs, Richter Crossroads, Browntown, Cottondale Airport, Cobb Crossroads and Tendil Crossing. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
